title: Marketing Manager, Strategic Enterprise Partnerships
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Wolt is one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies, on a mission to make cities better places to live by building a platform that connects people with the best of their neighborhoods—whether it’s food, groceries, or retail. Operating in over 25 countries, Wolt’s success is driven by a deep focus on customer experience, local relevance, and a culture that empowers people to take ownership and make an impact.

In Germany, our marketing team is made up of talented, passionate, and impact-driven professionals working across brand, growth, retention, and partnerships marketing.

This role, Marketing Manager for Strategic Enterprise Partnerships, sits at the intersection of marketing and commercial strategy. You’ll define how we work with national restaurant partners from a marketing perspective—leading co-branded campaigns, shaping scalable frameworks and unlocking long-term growth for Wolt.

What you’ll be doing

Location: Berlin HQ

We’re looking for an experienced marketing leader to take full ownership of our Strategic Enterprise Partnerships Marketing function in Germany. Your mission: unlock untapped growth potential by defining and implementing a structured, scalable marketing approach in close collaboration with national enterprise restaurant partners and Wolt’s account management and commercial teams. You’ll shape how we work with strategic enterprise partners from a marketing perspective—aligning on shared business goals, delivering measurable impact through co-marketing initiatives, and creating long-term value through a repeatable and data-informed approach.

You will work with one more team member as a peer on Strategic Enterprise Partnerships Marketing to ensure strong operational execution, growth, and collaboration.

This role is central to Wolt Germany’s growth strategy and requires a balance of strategic thinking, cross-functional leadership, and hands-on campaign expertise.

Day-to-day in this role, you’ll:

Strategic Leadership & Framework Development


Update, build, and lead Wolt’s marketing approach to strategic enterprise partnerships.
Define a scalable operating model, including goal-setting frameworks, partner segmentation, reporting, and co-marketing processes.
Identify and activate high-impact marketing opportunities that align with commercial strategy and partner priorities.


Campaign Development & Execution


With the wider local marketing team, develop and roll out full-funnel 360° campaigns across paid media, OOH, CRM, and in-app channels.
Create co-branded initiatives and promotional concepts tailored to partner goals and customer behavior.
Prioritize and manage budgets to maximize performance and ROI.


Cross-Functional & Partner Collaboration


Work closely with commercial, account management, and sales teams to align on partner strategies, timelines, and deliverables.
Build trusted relationships with senior marketing stakeholders on the partner side to shape and deliver joint marketing plans.
Provide internal enablement (e.g., toolkits, briefs, and guidance) to scale high-quality partner marketing across markets.


Brand, CRM & Customer Experience


Ensure that partner brand identity is well-represented and consistent within the Wolt app and across campaign assets.
Collaborate on CRM, co-branding, and cross-promotion initiatives to engage users and drive conversion.
Support messaging development and oversee execution across email, push, pop-ups, and incentive campaigns.


Insights, Reporting & Playbook Creation


Analyze campaign and channel performance to assess impact, improve outcomes, and optimize spend.
Deliver regular performance reporting to internal and external stakeholders.
Systematize learnings into playbooks that can be scaled across other strategic partnerships.


Our humble expectations


6+ years of marketing experience, with a strong focus on B2C and strategic partnership marketing within a platform, tech, or FMCG environment.
Proven success in working cross-functionally and building structured, scalable marketing programs.
Experience in managing stakeholders, with strong leadership and communication skills, internally and externally.
Expertise in paid media, CRM, promotional marketing, and co-branded campaign development.
Strategic, data-driven, and results-oriented mindset.
Fluent in both German and English (written and spoken) – this is essential for working with our local partners and internal teams.


What we offer


Exciting Challenges: You'll be at the forefront of building the new vertical strategy at Wolt and creating marketing strategies for our partners, facing dynamic and engaging challenges in a fast-paced environment.
Impactful Work: Your efforts will directly contribute to the success of our partners, helping them drive sales, attract new customers, and strengthen their awareness within the Wolt platform.
Professional Growth: Joining a team of marketing experts, you'll have opportunities for career development and skill enhancement while staying at the cutting edge of digital marketing and analytics.
Collaborative Environment: You'll work closely with external stakeholders, agencies, and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and innovation in achieving common goals.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, ensuring your dedication and expertise are rewarded appropriately.
Dynamic Culture: Join a company known for its innovative and forward-thinking culture, where adaptability and strategic thinking are highly valued.
Immediate Impact: Begin your role as soon as possible, making an immediate impact on our restaurant partners and the Wolt platform.
Flexible working hours & hybrid model
Dog-friendly office culture.


Next steps

If you're excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an ambitious team, click below to apply and get the conversation started!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for:


Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional in an international environment
Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company


After submitting your application, our Talent Acquisition team will review your profile. If it looks like a good fit, you’ll go through a few rounds of interviews with the hiring manager, team members, and stakeholders. The process is designed to be transparent, efficient, and give you a real feel for life at Wolt.

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Marketing Manager - New Verticals, Wolt Market (m/f/x)
description:
About Wolt

At Wolt, we create technology that brings joy, simplicity and earnings to the neighborhoods of the world. In 2014 we started with delivery of restaurant food. Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

We are on a mission to grow our New Vertical (Retail) business within Germany, and we are now looking for a commercially driven marketer with a growth mindset to join our team. As Wolt Market Marketing Manager in the NV and Partnerships team, you will be responsible for driving Wolt Market growth and managing relationships with local, regional and global teams, reporting directly to the Head of Regional NV and Partnership Marketing.

You will closely collaborate with the country’s NV marketing and Wolt Market regional and global counterparts in order to develop marketing initiatives that will fit into the overarching regional New Vertical strategy.

You will have the opportunity to develop, together with the New Vertical Marketing Managers, Wolt Market regional level campaigns and initiatives, contributing to the overall growth and success of our New Verticals in Germany.

You will leverage your expertise in relationship building, for identifying mutually beneficial marketing strategies that aim to grow both, Wolt Market and Retail Vertical in Germany.

Additionally, you’ll be responsible for analyzing Wolt Market performance in order to identify growth opportunities and provide actionable insights. working closely with New Verticals marketing managers to drive initiatives that drive regional growth and success.

What you'll be doing


Be responsible for driving Wolt Market growth together with local NV Marketing stakeholders in Germany
You will work closely with our Wolt Market global as well as local stakeholders, to meet country-specific and regional growth targets for Wolt Market in line with New Vertical growth strategy.
Analyze data to evaluate current Wolt Market performance, identify gaps, propose actionable solutions, and drive their implementation.
Propose and drive marketing initiatives for Wolt Market, ensuring alignment with country strategies and regional New Vertical growth targets.
Project manage regional and local Wolt Market campaigns to support the local New Vertical Marketing Manager and local Wolt Market team.
Manage marketing projects related to new store opening and market launches, collaborating closely with local New Vertical Marketing Managers to ensure seamless execution.
Taking ownership of Global/ Regional Wolt Market marketing initiatives that drive Wolt Market growth for the region.
Building and maintaining strong key account management relationships to foster effective collaboration and sustained growth.
Participate in annual vendor negotiations and develop joint marketing strategies, aligning with country New Verticals marketing and Ads teams.
Collaborate with regional CRM, brand function to oversee the regional visual and CRM approach. Coordinate WM campaign management, asset delivery, execution.
Support with initiatives to accelerate growth, enhance efficiency and streamline regional processes through scalable solutions and automations.
Act as DRI for leading all Wolt Market global initiatives as well as for aligning regional initiatives with global and local stakeholders.


Our humble expectations


Marketing Experience: Proven experience in marketing, preferably within e-commerce and/or retail.
Stakeholder Management: Strong ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders across global and local teams.
Commercial Mindset: Track record of developing and executing marketing initiatives that drive business growth.
Data-Driven Approach: Proficiency in analyzing performance data, identifying growth opportunities, and translating insights into actionable strategies.
Partnerships & Collaboration: Experience in fostering relationships with retail partners and other key stakeholders.
Strategic & Tactical Balance: Ability to manage long-term strategic planning while ensuring short-term execution in a fast-paced environment.
Project Management: Hands-on experience in marketing project management, leading cross-functional initiatives with both internal and external stakeholders.
International Exposure: Experience working in global environments or collaborating with teams across different countries is a plus.
Mindset & Approach: Open-minded, adaptable, and solutions-oriented with a proactive and can-do attitude.
Negotiation Skills: Strong ability to negotiate and influence outcomes effectively.
Industry Expertise: Background in Category Management and/or the retail industry on the partner side is beneficial.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in English & German (C1+ or native level).


What we offer


Exciting Challenges: You'll be at the forefront of building the new vertical strategy at Wolt and creating marketing strategies for our partners, facing dynamic and engaging challenges in a fast-paced environment.
Impactful Work: Your efforts will directly contribute to the success of our partners, helping them drive sales, attract new customers, and strengthen their awareness within the Wolt platform.
Professional Growth: Joining a team of marketing experts, you'll have opportunities for career development and skill enhancement while staying at the cutting edge of digital marketing and analytics.
Collaborative Environment: You'll work closely with external stakeholders, agencies, and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and innovation in achieving common goals.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, ensuring your dedication and expertise are rewarded appropriately.
Dynamic Culture: Join a company known for its innovative and forward-thinking culture, where adaptability and strategic thinking are highly valued.
Immediate Impact: Begin your role as soon as possible, making an immediate impact on our restaurant partners and the Wolt platform.
Flexible working hours & hybrid model
Dog-friendly office culture.


Next steps

If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Regional Restaurant Marketing Specialist
description:
About Wolt

Now we’re building the delivery of (almost) everything and you’ll find us in over 500 cities in 30 countries around the world. In 2022 we joined forces with DoorDash and together we keep on dreaming big and expanding across the globe.

Working at Wolt isn’t always easy, but it’s definitely exciting. Here you’ll learn more, build more, and ship more than in most other companies. You’ll be challenged a lot, but also have a lot of fun on the way. So, if you’re a self-starter with drive and entrepreneurial spirit, this could be the ride of your life.

Wolt is one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies, on a mission to make cities better places to live by building a platform that connects people with the best of their neighborhoods—whether it’s food, groceries, or retail. Operating in over 25 countries, Wolt’s success is driven by a deep focus on customer experience, local relevance, and a culture that empowers people to take ownership and make an impact.

In Germany, our marketing team is made up of talented, passionate and impact-driven professionals working across brand, growth, retention, and partnerships marketing.

This role, Regional Restaurant Marketing Specialist, offers a unique opportunity to shape Wolt’s restaurant marketing strategy across West, South, and Central Germany. With a strong focus on local market insight and partner collaboration, you’ll develop tailored marketing plans that drive visibility and growth for our key restaurant partners in cities such as Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, and Stuttgart.

What you’ll be doing

Location: Berlin HQ (with regular travel to West, South and Central Germany) or alternative Location: Munich or Cologne office, with regular visits to Berlin HQ

As a Regional Marketing Specialist for Restaurants, you’ll be at the forefront of strengthening Wolt’s brand and commercial success by building impactful, on-the-ground restaurant marketing strategies tailored to the gastronomy scene in West, South and Central Germany. Your focus will be on activating our key SMB Restaurant Partners in cities like Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, Stuttgart and beyond - bringing them visibility, growth, and customer engagement on the Wolt platform.

This is a unique, hybrid role combining strategic marketing skills with a hands-on, partner-facing approach, ideally suited for someone who thrives at the intersection of local food culture, creative marketing, and commercial collaboration.

Day-to-day in this role, you’ll:

Local Market Strategy & Partner Activation


Develop and execute tailored restaurant marketing strategies across cities in West, South and Central Germany, based on your local market expertise.
Identify and capitalize on hyper-local marketing opportunities (e.g. city festivals, seasonal events, cultural moments).
Build and leverage existing relationships with top-tier restaurant partners in the region to co-create exciting marketing activations.


Hands-On Campaign Execution


Activate restaurant partners through on-the-ground support - from campaign planning to execution - to drive customer demand and visibility.
Execute 360 marketing plans, including advertising across various channels (paid, owned, earned), promotions, and co-branded initiatives.
Collaborate closely with the local Berlin-based Marketing team and our agencies to adapt national strategies into localized initiatives.
Manage regional/ partner marketing budgets, ensuring efficient resource allocation and adherence to financial targets.


Partner Relationship Management


Act as a trusted marketing advisor to key restaurant partners, helping them understand and use Wolt’s marketing tools effectively.
Closely collaborate with account management and local sales teams to align on priorities, performance goals, and joint marketing opportunities.


Performance Reporting, Data Analysis & Insights:


Track, analyze, optimize and report on marketing performance metrics at the regional and partner level.
Use data-based insights to optimize marketing strategies and improve return on investment (ROI).
Provide feedback from the field to continuously improve and shape local marketing strategies.


Our humble expectations


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, with 4-6 years of marketing experience and a proven track record in campaign execution and partner collaboration.
Strong ties to the gastronomy scene in West and/ or South and Central Germany are definitely a plus - whether through previous roles in food-tech, hospitality, FMCG, or lifestyle/urban marketing.
Strategic thinking and results-oriented mindset.
Hands-on attitude: You are comfortable rolling up your sleeves and moving from strategy to execution—whether coordinating a photo shoot at a restaurant, setting up a pop-up activation, or meeting partners face-to-face to bring a campaign to life.
Bonus: Previous experience in sales or account management is a strong plus.
Native German speaking & business fluent in English
Compliance awareness and adaptability in a dynamic marketing landscape.
Willingness to travel regularly between Berlin and key cities in West, South and Central Germany.


What we offer


Exciting Challenges: You'll be at the forefront of building the new vertical strategy at Wolt and creating marketing strategies for our partners, facing dynamic and engaging challenges in a fast-paced environment.
Impactful Work: Your efforts will directly contribute to the success of our partners, helping them drive sales, attract new customers, and strengthen their awareness within the Wolt platform.
Professional Growth: Joining a team of marketing experts, you'll have opportunities for career development and skill enhancement while staying at the cutting edge of digital marketing and analytics.
Collaborative Environment: You'll work closely with external stakeholders, agencies, and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and innovation in achieving common goals.
Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, ensuring your dedication and expertise are rewarded appropriately.
Dynamic Culture: Join a company known for its innovative and forward-thinking culture, where adaptability and strategic thinking are highly valued.
Immediate Impact: Begin your role as soon as possible, making an immediate impact on our restaurant partners and the Wolt platform.
Flexible working hours & hybrid model
Dog-friendly office culture.


Next steps

If you're excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an ambitious team, click below to apply and get the conversation started!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for:


Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional in an international environment
Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company


After submitting your application, our Talent Acquisition team will review your profile. If it looks like a good fit, you’ll go through a few rounds of interviews with the hiring manager, team members, and stakeholders. The process is designed to be transparent, efficient, and give you a real feel for life at Wolt.

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Wolt is one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies, on a mission to make cities better places to live by building a platform that connects people with the best of their neighborhoods—whether it’s food, groceries, or retail. Operating in over 25 countries, Wolt’s success is driven by a deep focus on customer experience, local relevance, and a culture that empowers people to take ownership and make an impact.

In Germany, our marketing team is made up of talented, passionate and impact-driven professionals working across brand, growth, retention, and partnerships marketing.

This role, Regional Restaurant Marketing Specialist, offers a unique opportunity to shape Wolt’s restaurant marketing strategy across West, South, and Central Germany. With a strong focus on local market insight and partner collaboration, you’ll develop tailored marketing plans that drive visibility and growth for our key restaurant partners in cities such as Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, and Stuttgart.

What you’ll be doing

Location: Berlin HQ (with regular travel to West, South and Central Germany) or alternative Location: Munich or Cologne office, with regular visits to Berlin HQ

As a Regional Marketing Specialist for Restaurants, you’ll be at the forefront of strengthening Wolt’s brand and commercial success by building impactful, on-the-ground restaurant marketing strategies tailored to the gastronomy scene in West, South and Central Germany. Your focus will be on activating our key SMB Restaurant Partners in cities like Cologne, Düsseldorf, Munich, Frankfurt, Stuttgart and beyond - bringing them visibility, growth, and customer engagement on the Wolt platform.

This is a unique, hybrid role combining strategic marketing skills with a hands-on, partner-facing approach, ideally suited for someone who thrives at the intersection of local food culture, creative marketing, and commercial collaboration.

Day-to-day in this role, you’ll:

Local Market Strategy & Partner Activation

  • Develop and execute tailored restaurant marketing strategies across cities in West, South and Central Germany, based on your local market expertise.
  • Identify and capitalize on hyper-local marketing opportunities (e.g. city festivals, seasonal events, cultural moments).
  • Build and leverage existing relationships with top-tier restaurant partners in the region to co-create exciting marketing activations.

Hands-On Campaign Execution

  • Activate restaurant partners through on-the-ground support - from campaign planning to execution - to drive customer demand and visibility.
  • Execute 360 marketing plans, including advertising across various channels (paid, owned, earned), promotions, and co-branded initiatives.
  • Collaborate closely with the local Berlin-based Marketing team and our agencies to adapt national strategies into localized initiatives.
  • Manage regional/ partner marketing budgets, ensuring efficient resource allocation and adherence to financial targets.

Partner Relationship Management

  • Act as a trusted marketing advisor to key restaurant partners, helping them understand and use Wolt’s marketing tools effectively.
  • Closely collaborate with account management and local sales teams to align on priorities, performance goals, and joint marketing opportunities.

Performance Reporting, Data Analysis & Insights:

  • Track, analyze, optimize and report on marketing performance metrics at the regional and partner level.
  • Use data-based insights to optimize marketing strategies and improve return on investment (ROI).
  • Provide feedback from the field to continuously improve and shape local marketing strategies.

Our humble expectations

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Marketing, with 4-6 years of marketing experience and a proven track record in campaign execution and partner collaboration.
  • Strong ties to the gastronomy scene in West and/ or South and Central Germany are definitely a plus - whether through previous roles in food-tech, hospitality, FMCG, or lifestyle/urban marketing.
  • Strategic thinking and results-oriented mindset.
  • Hands-on attitude: You are comfortable rolling up your sleeves and moving from strategy to execution—whether coordinating a photo shoot at a restaurant, setting up a pop-up activation, or meeting partners face-to-face to bring a campaign to life.
  • Bonus: Previous experience in sales or account management is a strong plus.
  • Native German speaking & business fluent in English
  • Compliance awareness and adaptability in a dynamic marketing landscape.
  • Willingness to travel regularly between Berlin and key cities in West, South and Central Germany.

What we offer

  • Exciting Challenges: You'll be at the forefront of building the new vertical strategy at Wolt and creating marketing strategies for our partners, facing dynamic and engaging challenges in a fast-paced environment.
  • Impactful Work: Your efforts will directly contribute to the success of our partners, helping them drive sales, attract new customers, and strengthen their awareness within the Wolt platform.
  • Professional Growth: Joining a team of marketing experts, you'll have opportunities for career development and skill enhancement while staying at the cutting edge of digital marketing and analytics.
  • Collaborative Environment: You'll work closely with external stakeholders, agencies, and cross-functional teams, fostering collaboration and innovation in achieving common goals.
  • Competitive Compensation: We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, ensuring your dedication and expertise are rewarded appropriately.
  • Dynamic Culture: Join a company known for its innovative and forward-thinking culture, where adaptability and strategic thinking are highly valued.
  • Immediate Impact: Begin your role as soon as possible, making an immediate impact on our restaurant partners and the Wolt platform.
  • Flexible working hours & hybrid model
  • Dog-friendly office culture.

Next steps

If you're excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an ambitious team, click below to apply and get the conversation started!

Along with a competitive salary and benefits, you will also be eligible for:

  • Opportunity to be part of building something exceptional in an international environment
  • Lots of learning and growth in a globally scaling tech company

After submitting your application, our Talent Acquisition team will review your profile. If it looks like a good fit, you’ll go through a few rounds of interviews with the hiring manager, team members, and stakeholders. The process is designed to be transparent, efficient, and give you a real feel for life at Wolt.

Please note that we do not accept applications sent by mail. You should submit your application through our careers website!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

title: Marketing Manager (m/f/d)
description:
Company Description

Flink is the leading quick commerce player in Europe. We are on a mission to give people back time: You can order your groceries through our app and we deliver to your doorstep in minutes. We carry 3,000 products with a focus on the leading brands in each category. We aim for sustainability by making deliveries on electric bikes and utilizing recyclable packaging.

Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2024 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world’s most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. We take great pride in being an inclusive employer that offers equal opportunities, and we celebrate the diversity and multiculturalism of our team. We're growing fast and always pushing ourselves to do better - we play for #1.

Job Description

We’re looking for a proactive and organized Marketing Manager (m/f/d) to lead the execution of our marketing strategy in the German market. You’ll be responsible for turning business goals into customer-facing initiatives, coordinating with cross-functional teams, and ensuring our campaigns land effectively—both online and offline.

Role

You’ll report directly to the Marketing Lead and play a central role in planning, executing, and optimizing marketing activities that move the needle. As part of your role you will:


Own the marketing calendar: Build and manage it in close alignment with commercial, brand, CRM, performance, and operations teams.
Drive impactful campaigns: Translate business and seasonal priorities into successful 360° campaigns across owned and paid media.
Lead local execution: Coordinate assets and rollouts across CRM, app, offline, and performance to ensure a consistent, high-quality brand experience.
Boost visibility & local impact: Identify brand visibility opportunities and lead on-the-ground initiatives in key cities to grow awareness and reach.
Collaborate and optimize: Work cross-functionally to bring campaigns to life, support market expansions, and continuously improve based on data and KPIs.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in marketing roles, ideally in consumer goods, retail, or digital services
Native-level German and fluent English
Experience planning and executing 360° campaigns, including offline marketing
Strong project management skills—you keep timelines, people, and priorities in check
Excellent cross-functional communication skills and stakeholder management
A doer mentality. You’re hands-on, pragmatic, and solution-oriented


Bonus Points


Experience in food, grocery, lifestyle, or e-commerce
Familiarity with tools like Jira, Braze, Notifly, Looker


Additional Information


A €1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 35 EUR per month for Deutschland Ticket subsidy
A discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance


Wir verpflichten uns, dass jede:r Bewerber:in nach seinen Fähigkeiten beurteilt wird, unabhängig von Alter, Geschlechtsidentität, ethnischer Zugehörigkeit, sexueller Orientierung, Handicap oder Religion.
Show more

title: Brand Lead
description:
We’re hiring for one of the most exciting new brands in the digital lottery space – think dream homes, big campaigns, and real social impact!




They’ve launched a product that gives people the chance to win stunning, fully furnished homes – and every ticket supports a good cause. Now they need a Brand Lead to help scale it to the next level.




Role: Brand Lead
Location: Hamburg- flexible working- 1x per month in office!
Salary: €100k +




****Must be fluent in German****




You’ll Be:

Owning brand & marketing strategy from the ground up
Leading creative campaigns across social, influencer, TV, OOH + more
Working closely with media, product, creative, and performance teams
Turning big data into smart decisions
Making sure every touchpoint is on-brand, on-point, and on fire 🔥




You Bring:

Brand leadership experience in eCom, startup or scale-up
A blend of creative flair + data smarts
German & English fluency
Passion for building brands with purpose




Perks:

€1,500 dev budget 💸
Unlimited holiday + 30 days base 🌴
€30 mobility budget + bike leasing 🚲
Hybrid working + WorkFlex abroad 🌍
Pension, gym pass, regular team events 🎉




Don’t be shy- apply now!

Show more

title: Marketing Manager - B2B & Lead Generation (w/m/d)
description:
DEGURA ist ein Insurance Tech-Unternehmen mit dem Headquarter in der wunderschönen Stadt Berlin. Gegründet wurde DEGURA im Jahr 2018.

Wir haben eine benutzerfreundliche Software entwickelt, die Arbeitnehmer:innen, Arbeitgeber:innen und Versicherungsunternehmen miteinander verbindet, um den gesamten Prozess der betrieblichen Altersvorsorge zu digitalisieren und zu vereinfachen. Außerdem haben wir ein hoch qualifiziertes Team von Berater:innen aufgebaut, das alle am Prozess beteiligten Parteien unterstützt.

Unsere Vision: unkomplizierte betriebliche Altersvorsorge für Alle. Digital. Transparent. Egal, ob Arbeitgeber:in oder Arbeitnehmer:in.

Wir haben bisher eine erstaunliche Reise hinter uns und wollen diesen Weg mit einem starken Team fortsetzen. Deshalb freuen wir uns, wenn du dich dieser Reise anschließt.

So sieht dein Job aus:


Entwicklung, Umsetzung und Optimierung von B2B- oder B2C-Lead-Generierungsstrategien (online und offline)
Planung, Durchführung und Analyse von Kampagnen zur Lead-Gewinnung über Kanäle wie E-Mail-Marketing, Social Media, PPC, SEO, Content Marketing, Webinare und Events
Identifikation und Nutzung neuer Akquisekanäle zur Lead-Generierung
Erstellung und Pflege von Landingpages, Lead-Magneten und Conversion Funnels
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit dem Vertrieb zur Qualifizierung und Weiterverfolgung generierter Leads
Nutzung von Tools zur Marketing Automation (z. B. Salesforce, Pardot)
Monitoring relevanter KPIs und Erstellung regelmäßiger Reportings zur Performance der Maßnahmen
Durchführung von A/B-Tests zur Optimierung der Conversion Rates


Requirements


Ein abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Marketing, Kommunikation, Wirtschaft oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation kannst du vorweisen
Du bringst Erfahrungen im Bereich Performance-Marketing, Online-Marketing und Lead-Generierung mit
Du verfügst über fundierte Kenntnisse in digitalen Marketingkanälen (SEO, SEA, Social Ads, E-Mail-Marketing) und hast auch Erfahrung mit CRM- und Marketing-Automation-Tools (z. B. Salesforce, Pardot, ActiveCampaign)
Analytisches Denkvermögen und Erfahrung im Umgang mit KPIs und Tracking-Tools (z. B. Piwik Pro)
Deine selbständige Arbeitsweise ist strukturiert und ergebnisorientiert
Du verfügst über stark ausgeprägte Verhandlungs- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch und in Englisch
Unsere Teamkultur ist uns extrem wichtig, deshalb suchen wir Persönlichkeiten, welche unser DEGURA-Team bereichern und auf die wir uns verlassen können.


Benefits

Zusätzlich zu unserem wunderbaren Team, unserer fantastischen Kultur und unserer großartigen Vision, gibt es eine Vielzahl von Benefits, die Degura zu einem attraktiven Arbeitgeber machen! Was dich zusätzlich erhaltet:


Tauche mit uns in die Start-up-Welt ein
Ein hocheffektives Arbeitsumfeld mit flachen Hierarchien und kurzen Entscheidungswegen
Marktgerechte Vergütung
100 % Zuschuss von uns zu deiner bAV
Ein Gesundheitsbudget in Höhe von 800 Euro pro Jahr
Zuschuss zum ÖPNV
Zuschuss zum Corporate Fitness vom Urban Sports Club
Großzügiges Urlaubskontingent
Ein flexibles Arbeitsumfeld (Office und Remote) mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und mobilem Arbeiten, auch aus dem Ausland
Modernste Hardware und eine sehr gute Software-Infrastruktur
Persönliche Schulungen, die dich bei deiner persönlichen und beruflichen Entwicklung unterstützen
Regelmäßige Company- und Teamevents
Spare bares Geld mit unseren Firmenrabatten
Ein schönes Büro im Herzen von Berlin mit kostenlosen Getränken und Snacks


Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und Vielfalt. Deshalb diskriminieren wir nicht aufgrund von Herkunft, Religion, Hautfarbe, Geschlecht, sexueller Orientierung, Alter, Familienstand oder Behinderung.

Mit dem Absenden der Bewerbung bestätigst du, dass du die Datenschutzbestimmungen für das Bewerbungsverfahren gelesen und akzeptiert hast.
Show more

title: Marketing Manager - ERP & Digital Solutions
description:
Muller Solutions is a leading technology consulting firm specializing in ERP, digital transformation, outsourcing, and managed services. We partner with forward-thinking organizations to help them work smarter, scale faster, and stay ahead in today's fast-paced digital world.

💥 The Opportunity

Are you a strategic marketer who knows how to position complex IT solutions, build a brand people trust, and generate leads that convert? We're looking for an experienced Marketing Manager to own and execute our entire marketing strategy for our ERP & Digital Solutions portfolio — and make a real impact.

Requirements

✨ What You'll Do

As our Marketing Manager, you'll wear many hats — strategist, storyteller, digital wizard, and growth driver. You'll be responsible for:

✅ Branding: Shape and amplify our brand identity for ERP and digital solutions, ensuring we're recognized as a trusted partner in the market.

✅ SEO: Develop and implement SEO strategies to maximize search visibility and organic traffic.

✅ Content Marketing: Build and manage a robust content plan — including blogs, whitepapers, case studies, and thought leadership — to fuel SEO and lead generation.

✅ Lead Generation: Design and run creative multi-channel campaigns that attract, nurture, and convert qualified leads for our sales team.

✅ Social Media Management: Manage and grow our social media presence, fostering engagement and building a loyal community.

✅ Media Buying: Plan, negotiate, and execute media buys (PPC, digital ads, sponsorships) to expand reach and maximize ROI.

✅ Events & Webinars: Plan and host webinars, virtual sessions, and industry events to engage prospects and position us as thought leaders.

✅ Partner & Channel Marketing: Collaborate with technology partners (e.g., SAP) on joint marketing campaigns, leveraging available co-marketing funds.

✅ Marketing Automation & CRM: Build and manage lead nurturing workflows, ensuring strong alignment with sales and visibility across the funnel.

✅ PR & Thought Leadership: Develop PR strategies, craft press releases, and secure media coverage. Build thought leadership content that positions Muller Solutions as an expert in ERP, outsourcing, and digital transformation.

✅ Marketing Analytics & Reporting: Track, measure, and report on all marketing activities to ensure continuous improvement and clear ROI.

Who You Are

✔️ Proven experience in B2B marketing within the IT industry — ideally ERP (e.g., SAP), their partners, or outsourcing & managed services.

✔️ Deep understanding of branding and positioning for complex tech solutions.

✔️ Strong expertise in SEO, lead generation, content marketing, and paid media campaigns.

✔️ Hands-on experience with social media management and marketing automation tools.

✔️ Skilled in planning and hosting webinars or industry events.

✔️ Experience in PR campaigns and building thought leadership.

✔️ Data-driven, collaborative, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Benefits

💎 Why You'll Love Working With Us

✨ Be part of a dynamic team making a real impact in digital transformation.

✨ Work with leading partners and innovative clients.

✨ Bring your ideas to life and own initiatives from concept to results.

✨ Competitive salary, growth opportunities, and a supportive, flexible work culture.
Show more

✔️ Data-driven, collaborative, and able to thrive in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Benefits

💎 Why You'll Love Working With Us

✨ Be part of a dynamic team making a real impact in digital transformation.

✨ Work with leading partners and innovative clients.

✨ Bring your ideas to life and own initiatives from concept to results.

✨ Competitive salary, growth opportunities, and a supportive, flexible work culture.

title: Marketing Mangaer
description:
About the Company

The client is a technology company dedicated to the research and development of advanced scientific productivity tools. Driven by independent research and technological innovation, it has headquarters, research and development centers, and branch offices in multiple domestic and overseas locations. It is committed to providing diversified and full process solutions, productivity tools, and services to clients through the accumulation of core technologies such as artificial intelligence, robotics, automation, and automatic optical inspection, and deep integration with industry applications.




About the Role

The Europe Marketing Manager will be responsible for developing and executing Europe-focused marketing strategies to boost brand awareness, generate qualified sales leads, and maximize revenue based on the Europe market situation, product portfolio, and market competition landscape.




Responsibilities

Strategic Leadership: Develop & execute Europe-focused marketing strategies to boost brand awareness, generate qualified sales leads, and maximize revenue based on Europe market situation, product portfolio, and market competition landscape;
Multi-Channel Campaign Management: Plan & execute multi-channel marketing campaigns and online & offline promotions, including but not limited to webinar, email blast, social media, exhibitions and industry summits.
Content Creation: Produce high-quality marketing collateral including flyers, brochures, videos, social posts and so on.
Execution & Analytics: Oversee campaign timelines/budgets, track ROI/performance metrics (KPIs), and continuously optimize. Analyze marketing activities effectiveness and report to leadership/stakeholders.
Digital Hub: Maintain & optimize the official website (SEO, UX, content updates).
Lead Management: Maintain sales lead database and implement tracking/reporting.
Adaptability: Handle additional tasks as directed.




Qualifications

Education: Master degree in Cell/Molecular Biology, Genetics, Immunology, or related majors.
Experience: 3-5 years in marketing within the Life Science/Biopharma industry.




Required Skills

Strategic Planning: Demonstrated ability to design marketing strategies & tactical plans.

Digital Marketing: Proficiency with LinkedIn, Google Ads/Analytics, and other relevant platforms.
Communication: Excellent verbal, written, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Analytics: Strong ROI tracking, budget management, and performance analysis.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to work seamlessly with Sales, Product, and other departments.




Preferred Skills

Mindset:

Results-Driven: Owns outcomes and performance metrics.
Innovative & Future-Oriented: Proactively seeks new approaches for growth.
Open & Adaptable: Welcomes feedback, new ideas, and diverse perspectives/cultures.
Place: Based in Germany, Munich.




To Apply: Interested candidates are invited to submit a comprehensive application including a resume and salary expectation to Nancy Zhang. Email: nancy.zhang@brunel.net








title: Social Media Manager W/M/D
description:
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.

Who We Are…

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…

From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

Your New Role

The Social Media team is on a mission to drive connection with our passionate audiences and brand defining moments that shake you, move you, and stay with you.

The team is part of the Brand and Content Marketing team in EMEA, and you will collaborate closely within the team to grow brand and content love across local social channels. You will be the Social Media Manager for Germany and our leading expert in the areas of: Original Productions (Germany), German social audiences, Local content creators & events. You will also take a role in driving moments of brand love across EMEA.

Your mission is to launch HBO Max in Germany, build a strong, engaged follower base, and drive brand awareness and love. As German social lead, you will own, create and implement the local brand strategy and work towards the perfect split between local content and global IPs represented in our communities.

As Manager of Local Productions (DE), you lead the strategy, creative execution, and campaign rollouts to drive maximum social impact for HBO Max' local content. With a sharp eye for local trends and audience insights, you craft distinct, high-performing campaigns in close collaboration with regional stakeholders, activating industry tastemakers on social and curating content creators.

A

s Social Manager in Germany, you lead the launch and daily management of local social handles, creating organic and editorial content that reflects and celebrates community diversity. You stay plugged into local trends, collaborate with partners on events and campaigns, and drive visibility and performance. You own market localization, from crafting tailored copy to ensuring high-quality ideas, captions, and visuals that resonate - and manage vibrant community communications, partnering with CX for best-in-class engagement and crisis response.

Your Role Accountabilities


Launching the HBO Max streaming service in Germany and all relevant social handles.
Leading local campaigns on German Original Productions ensuring creative & innovative campaigns from first brainstorm to final report on high-tentpole level in collaboration with the local German team, briefing internal creative teams and agencies when relevant.
You work with the social Performance team for optimal performance, relevant reporting, audience analysis, and collaboration w/relevant partners.
You drive engagement and awareness through a mix of creative, innovative ideas & formats, and tried-and-tested best practices, and work to elevate German productions across EMEA where relevant.
As the local lead in Germany, you own the local strategy for content creators (campaign based + always-on), cover local events on social and initiate impactful collaborations with local talent.


As part of the Brand & Content Social Streaming team, your areas of responsibility also include:


Managing and owning your local Social Media handles strategy
Creating, planning, managing, executing, and evaluating pan-European organic social media campaigns focused on engagement, retention, non-standard activations, and community building.
Leading social media campaign development for global originals, Sport and other key brand initiatives.
Creating tailored, out-of-the-box content in collaboration with our in-house design team.
Working creatively with the content of the service to build awareness, drive engagement, and conversation on social media.
Owning the daily interaction with our fans, working with the CX team, ensuring they’re informed, engaged, and following our tone-of-voice.
Monitoring and reporting on local audience sentiments and trends.
Staying on top of social media creative trends and ensuring top level social media marketing campaigns locally and on a pan-European level.


Skills And Experience Required


+3 years’ experience in social media/marketing brand and/or content
Flexible mindset, ready to adapt to a fast-paced, changing environment.
Great understanding for and experience working with fan communities.
Great knowledge and understanding of our brand and content - and its values.
Skills in project and budget management.
A self-sufficient and proactive approach to their work.
Strong skills in creative ideation & copywriting.
Strong campaign management skills and experience in campaign planning.
Fluency in written and spoken German & English. Great communication skills and relationship management.
A genuine, enthusiastic, and passionate fan of pop culture and new trends with knowledge and excitement for our content and product.


How We Get Things Done…

This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

Championing Inclusion at WBD

Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects a wide array of perspectives, backgrounds and experiences. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, regardless of sex, gender identity, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religion or belief, marital status, pregnancy, parenthood, disability or any other category protected by law. Severely disabled employees are welcome in our company and will be given special consideration if they are equally qualified. Flexible working hours are offered to assist.

If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you require adjustments or accommodations during the job application and/or recruitment process, please visit our accessibility page for instructions to submit your request.

title: Senior Media Buyer
description:
Happy Mammoth is a rapidly expanding natural food tech company with a presence in the United States, Australia, and Europe. We are experts in crafting, manufacturing, and promoting gut health foods, digestive aids, and microbiome-focused supplements. Our mission is to empower clients to embrace lasting health transformations and rediscover vibrant living.

We are looking for an experienced Senior Media Buyer to join our growing Marketing team full-time.

Top Reasons to Work at Happy Mammoth:

A Strong Salary Package: We’ll pay you well because your skills and hard work deserve the best.

Paid Holidays: Take all the time you need to binge-watch your favorite shows, explore new places, or just relax. It’s on us!

Work from Anywhere: Whether it’s your couch, a trendy café, or a co-working space by the beach (lucky you), the world is your office.

Join a Vibrant Team: Teamwork makes the dream work! You’ll be part of a global crew that’s as talented as they are friendly.

Flexible Working Hours: Manage your schedule how it fits best for you—late-night productivity, early morning hustle, or everything in between.

Opportunities for Growth: We’ll give you free books, courses, and all the resources you need to level up your skills and keep excelling.

Dynamic Work Environment: No two days are the same here. Embrace new challenges and excitement every day in a diverse, fast-paced workplace.

Make a Difference: Join our mission to help clients improve their health and live more fulfilling lives. It’s not just a job—it’s a chance to make a real impact!

Before you dive deeper, please note the following key points:


This is a full-time fully remote contractor role
We are seeking someone preferably with a background in B2C marketing
Although the role is remote, the candidate must be available during EU hours (GMT)


Qualifications:


Proven experience managing large ad budgets ($100K+)
Hands-on experience with eCommerce accounts (bonus if in health or supplements)
Demonstrated long-term success driving consistent results across ROAS and CPA metrics
Strong understanding of targeting nuances for Australia, the United States, and EU markets
Creative thinker with the ability to write clear, compelling creative briefs
Experience building effective funnels and upsell sequences for physical eCommerce products
Familiarity with additional channels such as Twitter or Pinterest is a plus
Bonus: Experience with direct response marketing


Key Responsibilities:


Plan, launch, and optimize high-budget paid media campaigns across Facebook, Instagram and other platforms
Manage and scale eCommerce advertising campaigns with a focus on ROAS and CPA performance
Write clear, strategic creative briefs
Build and test full-funnel strategies including upsells, retargeting, and conversion-focused journeys
Adapt targeting and creative approaches for key regions, including Australia, the U.S., and EU markets
Analyze campaign data, generate insights, and continuously improve performance
Stay ahead of platform changes, industry trends, and competitor strategies


CVs must be in English

title: Marketing Manager
description:
Your mission

Cariqa is here to make EV charging work - faster, safer and completely transparent. We’ve built an omnichannel platform that gives Charge Point Operators total control: control pricing, get paid directly, and reach drivers however they want to pay. No markups. No middlemen. Just a transparent platform that helps clean transport scale. We’re not tweaking the old model. We’re replacing it.

We’re backed by leading investors in both climate and fintech - supporting our mission to bring direct, fair, and transparent payments to EV charging.We’re now actively growing our team. If you want to be part of this journey, apply now. And one day, when you plug in your EV and see a fair price at the charge point, you’ll know you helped make that happen.

Your profile

We’re looking for a highly motivated, entrepreneurial marketing rockstar to build Cariqa’s marketing function from the ground up. Reporting to the Co-founder and CEO, you’ll define and execute strategies that generate awareness, excitement, and trust among Charge Point Operators (CPOs) and other key players in the EV ecosystem across Europe.

This is a hands-on, entrepreneurial role where you’ll define and drive our marketing strategy, create the core content and assets we need to scale, and launch campaigns that directly fuel sales and product growth. You’ll collaborate closely with the commercial team to power our pipeline, with the product team to turn features into clear customer value, and with leadership to position Cariqa as the most credible and trusted solution in EV charging.

At Cariqa, our goal is to build a best-in-class platform that transforms the EV charging industry on a global scale. If you're a fast-moving, self-motivated, and goal-oriented marketer looking for a once-in-a-generation opportunity to build a marketing function from scratch, we’d love to hear from you.

Your Responsibilities


Develop and maintain Cariqa’s positioning, messaging, and tone of voice
Plan and run campaigns to support lead generation, product launches, and CPO acquisition
Create content such as case studies, website copy, pitch decks, and newsletters
Support the sales team with collateral for outreach, events, and follow-ups
Manage our LinkedIn presence and other relevant channels
Monitor performance and optimize based on data and feedback
Gather insights from customers and competitors to inform marketing decisions


Why us?


Play a key role in scaling the platform that’s simplifying and improving EV charging across Europe
Work at the intersection of fintech and climate — combining the speed and innovation of fintech with the long-term impact of building a cleaner, fairer energy future
Join a focused and experienced team working across commercial, product and operations — building fast and with purpose
Competitive salary and equity package, with real ownership and the chance to grow with the company
Flexible hybrid setup with our Berlin HQ as your base
30 days paid vacation, benefit allowance, and a culture that values clarity and autonomy


About Us

Cariqa is the first end-to-end payment billing and pricing platform built for EV charging. Designed for charge point operators, the platform reduces cost, simplifies operations, and delivers consistent pricing across all customer channels - driving trust, efficiency and adoption across the EV ecosystem. Cariqa is headquartered in Berlin, with operations across Europe.

description_html:
Your mission

Cariqa is here to make EV charging work - faster, safer and completely transparent. We’ve built an omnichannel platform that gives Charge Point Operators total control: control pricing, get paid directly, and reach drivers however they want to pay. No markups. No middlemen. Just a transparent platform that helps clean transport scale. We’re not tweaking the old model. We’re replacing it.

We’re backed by leading investors in both climate and fintech - supporting our mission to bring direct, fair, and transparent payments to EV charging.We’re now actively growing our team. If you want to be part of this journey, apply now. And one day, when you plug in your EV and see a fair price at the charge point, you’ll know you helped make that happen.

Your profile

We’re looking for a highly motivated, entrepreneurial marketing rockstar to build Cariqa’s marketing function from the ground up. Reporting to the Co-founder and CEO, you’ll define and execute strategies that generate awareness, excitement, and trust among Charge Point Operators (CPOs) and other key players in the EV ecosystem across Europe.

This is a hands-on, entrepreneurial role where you’ll define and drive our marketing strategy, create the core content and assets we need to scale, and launch campaigns that directly fuel sales and product growth. You’ll collaborate closely with the commercial team to power our pipeline, with the product team to turn features into clear customer value, and with leadership to position Cariqa as the most credible and trusted solution in EV charging.

At Cariqa, our goal is to build a best-in-class platform that transforms the EV charging industry on a global scale. title: AliExpress-Social Media Senior Specialist-Munich
description:
Job Description

● Develop and implement social media/influencers strategies that align with our brand positioning and marketing strategies.

● Create original content and schedule postings to increase account visibility and engagement.

● Monitor and analyze performance data of social media accounts to continuously optimize content and strategy.

● Source and develop influencers networking continuously and work closely and innovatively with influencers to support brand and business growth.

● Collaborate with advertising agencies and vendors to manage and improve social media advertising campaigns.

● Community management .




Job Requirement

● At least 3 years of experience in social media planning and account management.

● Proficiency in content trends, viral marketing mindset and mechanisms of operation on platforms such as Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube.

● Excellent creative thinking and content creation skills.

● Strong data analysis skills, with the ability to adjust strategies based on data insights.

● A proactive, results-focused approach, capable of driving initiatives forward amidst uncertainty.

● Prior experience in e-commerce, retail, or FMCG sectors is highly advantageous. Candidates with substantial agency experience are also encouraged to apply.

● Ability to work independently as well as closely with a team.

● Proficiency in German and English is a must. Chinese language skill is a plus but not a prerequisite.

● BSc/BA in Marketing, Advertising or related field

title: Junior Online-Marketing-Manager (m/w/d)
description:
Aufgaben 


Unterstützung bei der kompletten Planung und Durchführung von B2B CRM-Kampagnen, inkl. Briefing, Segmentierung, Content Erstellung, wie Mailings und Landing Pages, Versand und Auswertung
Entwicklung von innovativen Mailautomatisierungen zur Neukundengewinnung durch individuelle Onboarding Prozesse
Reporting der Kampagnenperformance sowie KPI-getriebene Planung, Ausführung von Tests und stetige Optimierung von Kampagnen und Customer Journeys
Unterstützung beim Ausbau des Marketing Technology Stacks, der CRM-Lösungen und der Tracking-Funktionen
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit internen Teams wie Vertrieb, Redaktion, Kooperationen und Event


Qualifikation


Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder Studium im Bereich Marketing, Kommunikation, Medien oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation
2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Marketing, idealerweise mit Fokus auf B2B und Online-Marketing
Erfahrungen mit E-Mail-Marketing-Tools und CRM-Systemen sowie Systemen wie
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sowie gute Englischkenntnisse
Sorgfältige und strukturierte Arbeitsweise mit einem hohen Qualitätsbewusstsein
Hands-on-Mentalität, Eigeninitiative und Teamfähigkeit


Benefits


28 Tage Urlaub
Flexible Remote-Office-Möglichkeiten
Eine unbefristete Festanstellung mit einem herausfordernden und vielseitigen Aufgabengebiet
Ungekürzte Ausgaben unserer Professional Briefings
Moderne technische Ausstattung
Ein Büro in Berlin-Mitte mit dem Flair des Berliner Kult-Cafés Einstein
Wachstumskultur mit starken persönlichen und beruflichen Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten
Eine offene und freundliche Atmosphäre mit Partnern und Kollegen aus der ganzen Welt


Über uns

Als unabhängiges digitales Medienunternehmen mit über 140 Mitarbeitenden stehen wir, die Table Media GmbH, für qualitativ hochwertigen Journalismus („deep journalism“) und verbinden den Qualitätsanspruch von Leitmedien mit der Tiefenschärfe von Fachinformationen.

Unsere Professional Briefings analysieren politische, ökonomische und gesellschaftliche Fragen und informieren über aktuelle Entwicklungen und Trends. Sie werden von Competence Leaders aus der Politik, Wirtschaft und Wissenschaft gelesen und bieten somit Entscheidungsträgern in verschiedenen Branchen einen Informationsvorsprung und Wettbewerbsvorteil.

title: Enterprise Senior Account Director (m/f/d) - Talent Solutions
description:
Company Description

LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. We aspire to create a culture that’s built on trust, care, inclusion, and fun – where everyone can succeed.

Join us to transform the way the world works.

Job Description

This role will be based in Berlin or Munich, Germany.

At LinkedIn, our approach to flexible work is centered on trust and optimized for culture, connection, clarity, and the evolving needs of our business. The work location of this role is hybrid, meaning it will be performed both from home and from a LinkedIn office on select days, as determined by the business needs of the team.

Responsibilities:


Researches Customer’s business and prepares thoughtful questions and insights in advance of customer meetings
Asks layered, open-ended questions to understand and clarify Customer’s objectives and challenges beyond surface-level detail
Builds relationships with multiple stakeholders (vertically and horizontally) across the Customer’s organization
Shifts communication style and content to fit the needs of different stakeholders
Leads with Solutions, not products, when making recommendations aligned with Customer objectives
Sells with Integrity
Drives customer decision-making by achieving a shared vision and proactively considering the value props that tie all stakeholders together
Thinks commercially and applies business acumen when crafting & negotiating commercial agreements
Uses data and insights to support investment recommendations or overcome customer objections
Proactively mitigates churn risk by adopting a smart, customer-centric approach
Engages customers throughout to confirm and clarify value and adapts a strategy when needed to optimize ROI
Drives Customer growth by proactively identifying opportunities to deliver greater customer value
Applies business acumen in Account Planning by considering economic, industry, and company factors with a Customer-centric lens.
Maps all key stakeholders in an account to assess the strength of the account relationship and create account outreach strategy
Agrees to joint accountability with colleagues and cross-functional teams for optimal customer success
Practices humility and asks for help from colleagues when faced with a challenge or unknown
Is disciplined in Territory and Account Planning, Forecasting, and Quota Attainment
Follows best practices when using CRM and other Sales tools in order to manage the Sales and Buyer cycles



Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:


7+ years of quota-carrying sales experience
3+ years of sales experience focusing on staffing or corporate clients
Business fluency in German and English



Preferred Qualifications:


Experience with HR software
Experience with SaaS opportunities
Experience selling IT solutions
Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
Strong negotiation and accurate forecasting skills
Experience carrying a revenue target with the ability to develop compelling strategies that deliver results
Excellent communication, negotiation and forecasting skills
Demonstrated ability to find and manage high-level business in an evangelistic sales environment
Ability to gather and use data to inform decision making and persuade others
Ability to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyers
Ability to orchestrate the closure of business with an accurate understanding of prospect needs
Ability to include multiple partners and members of the company management team using competitive selling to position company products against direct and indirect competitors



Suggested Skills:   


Negotiation and forecasting skills  
Consultative Selling   
Stakeholder Management   



Additional Information

Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates

Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.

title: Entrepreneur in Residence (m/f/x)
description:
We're looking for an ambitious, hands-on Entrepreneur in Residence (EiR) to help us discover, validate, and build new ventures from scratch. You'll work closely with our CEO to turn early-stage ideas into validated MVPs — through customer interviews, fast iterations, and market exploration.

If you love building from zero within a thriving start-up in climate tech, this role is for you.

Key Responsibilities 🎯


Validate new venture opportunities: You lead deep-dive market research and customer discovery to uncover pain points and white spaces
Build and test MVPs: You move fast from hypothesis to prototype, using low-code tools, mockups, and customer feedback to validate what works
Own pilot initiatives: You help set up and run early-stage pilots, translating insights into real-world traction and learnings
Drive customer-facing outreach: You initiate and manage cold outreach (calls, emails, lead funnels) to generate qualitative insights and interest
Create clarity from ambiguity: You develop clear slide decks and narratives to communicate opportunity areas internally and externally


This role is right for you if... ✨


You think and act like a founder — grit, ownership, and speed are second nature to you
You love talking to customers, exploring unfamiliar terrain, and turning insight into execution
You're structured in your thinking, clear in your communication, and hands-on in your approach
You thrive in ambiguity and see chaos as a creative opportunity
You're motivated by solving real-world problems and making a positive impact on the climate


Requirements

Skills & experience you will need 💪


Bachelor's degree, ideally in a field related to entrepreneurship, innovation, or tech — and a strong drive to build things that matter
You've built something before — ideally a company, MVP, or product (success or failure both welcome)
Strong analytical thinking and hypothesis testing mindset
Solid communication skills, especially in slide decks and user interviews
Self-starter with the ability to lead an initiative from scratch
Fluent in German and English


Benefits


Remote Working: Work from our hubs in Hamburg or Munich, or remote from Germany
Unlimited Vacation: Take as many holidays as you need — we trust you to recharge when it matters most
Flexible Working Hours: Work during the hours that align with your peak performance and lifestyle
Mental Health Matters: Access 1:1 psychologist sessions and workshops through our Bloom partnership
Professional Growth: Use a dedicated development budget to enhance your skills and career
Stock Option Plan: Receive virtual stocks as a reward for your trust, effort, and vision alignment
Unite, Recharge, Celebrate: Join in-person team retreats to connect and have fun
Explore Germany: Enjoy the Deutschlandticket for flexible public transportation access
Show more

title: Brand & Market Development Manager
description:
About Us

Kencana is one of Europe’s leading distributor of premium Korean beauty products, connecting the most exciting brands from Korea with top-tier European retailers such as Douglas, Flaconi, Zalando, and Notino. We specialize in identifying emerging trends, building exclusive brand partnerships, and executing successful market entries with speed, precision, and passion. With a fast-growing team and deep local expertise in both Europe and Korea, we help K-Beauty brands thrive in one of the world’s most dynamic beauty markets.




Role Overview

We are looking for an experienced Brand & Market Development Manager to help us shape the future of K-Beauty in Europe. You will be responsible for identifying upcoming trends and brands, managing Korean supplier relationships, and driving the successful launch of new products in close coordination with our internal teams. This role requires fluent Korean and a strong understanding of both Korean and European beauty markets.




Key Responsibilities




Supplier Relationship & Brand Partnerships




Build and manage long-term relationships with Korean brand partners, acting as the main point of contact
Conduct regular business reviews and align brand roadmaps with European market potential and retailer needs




Product Launch & Go-to-Market Execution




Coordinate the end-to-end launch process across internal teams (sales, content, marketing, logistics)
Support with product positioning, pricing strategies, and preparation of sales materials for key accounts




Trend Scouting & Innovation




Identify emerging K-Beauty brands and product innovations through social media, local networks, and trade fairs
Evaluate brand potential and compile market-entry recommendations based on consumer and retail trends




Sales & Marketing Enablement




Localize brand and product content from Korean into market-ready formats for sales, content, and marketing teams
Collaborate with the marketing team on brand storytelling, content planning, and influencer recommendations




Market Intelligence & Competitive Analysis




Track developments in the K-Beauty landscape and benchmark competitors across both Korean and European markets
Gather and analyze sell-out and performance data to identify optimization opportunities for our brand portfolio




Requirements




Fluent/ very good level in Korean and fluent English (German is a plus)
3+ years experience in brand management, business development, or international sales – ideally in the beauty or lifestyle sector
Strong interest in Korean beauty and global consumer trends
Excellent communication, coordination, and project management skills
Experience working across cultures and time zones
Regular travel to Korea (approx. 3–4 times/year) required – alternatively, you can be based in Korea full-time if preferred
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in business, marketing, or a related field
Show more
